just another thought
the other reason why I wrote this story is difference of 1 month 
between the birth of MInoru, the grandson, and the death of Motoko 
the granddaughter...so the household was pretty stressed out

*I clearly read on a board that Tsutomu continued to live in Bunkyo 
in close proximity to his parents once he married Midori...he moves 
away a couple of decades down the line probably after Tokio died
I can't imagine him leaving his mother alone for the 5 years after 
F.G. died

*after Midori graduated from Tokio's school she was a teacher...some 
translations say science teacher, but again it is nifty, so it would 
make sense if she found employment at the school or nearby 
institution 

I did keep double checking on the Japanese sites Motoko was born Sept 
28 and Fujita Goro died on Sept 28  it is a coincidence of numbers
**there are very old Chinese beliefs regarding death/birthday 
date "clashes"...this may be related to why once a person dies their 
deathday and not birthday is celebrated...nonetheless they are linked

although I don't check my horoscope everyday I think it is great fun 
to compare horoscopes between characters and form their personalities
Motoko, year of the rooster (2005=year of the rooster) and Fujita 
Goro, year of the Dragon combination is interesting.  Roosters are 
more outgoing and would be more attracted to quiet and reserved 
Dragons.
